choices.text: To splint fracture shaft of femur
To stabilize cervical spine after trauma

questions.text: Thomas splint was devised by Sir H.O Thomas for:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Option A-To splint fracture shaft of femur-thomas splint is used NOWADAYS. Option B-To stabilize cervical spine after trauma-hard cervical collar is used. Option C-For transportation of polytrauma patients-stretcher splint is used. Option D-For treating tuberculosis of knee-Thomas splint was devised by Sir H.O Thomas.This is the reason ,Thomas splint is aka T.K.splint.

questions.text: Name of the injury for which this surgery is done :
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-The Implant shown is Dynamic hip screw (DHS), used in I/T femur fracture and also Basicervical NOF fracture. Option B-In S/T femur fracture, PFN(proximal femoral nail) is used Option C-In fracture SOF, intramedullary nail is used.

questions.text: In Thomas splint, most troubling is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) In Thomas splint, most troubling is Ring Because it impinges against proximal thigh and causes irritation to patient.

questions.text: Identify the use of the instrument ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-for lumbar traction traction belts/kit is used. Option B-The image shown is k/a Crutchfields tongs used for cervical traction. Option C,D-For traction on tibia / femur , Steinman’s pin is used.

questions.text: Weight allowed in skeletal traction is up to :
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Skeletal traction is applied when moderate-severe force is required, with max weight permitted is upto 20kgs (upto 25-30% body weight).

choices.text: It is used to give skeletal traction
It has threads in the center of pin
It is used to give skeletal traction through calcaneum

questions.text: Which statement about Denham pin is true:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Option A-Denham pin is used to give skeletal traction in cancellous/osteoporotic bones. Option B-Denham pin has threads at the centre of pin Option C-Denham pin is used to give skeletal traction in cancellous bones such as calcaneum. Option D-All of above

questions.text: Action of intramedullary ‘K’ nail is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option B-K-Nail acts by the principle of 3-point bony fixation,The nail is fixed at at the two ends and at the isthmus.

choices.text: Spanning external fixator, fracture shaft tibia
Spanning external fixator, fracture shaft femur
Spanning external fixator, peri-articular fracture knee

questions.text: Identify the given device and the indication.
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option A,B,C-Spanning external fixator and it is used for peri-articular fracture knee. Option D-Ilizarov retractor has multiple ring like components and it is used for distraction histogenesis for lengthening of bones.

questions.text: In which of the following nerve injuries is the instrument shown below used?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-The image shown above is that of a cock-up splint. It is used to manage radial nerve palsy. Radial nerve palsy manifests as an inability to dorsiflex the wrist and digits (wrist drop and finger drop). Option B-Median nerve injury causes carpal tunnel syndrome. Option C-knuckle bender splint is used in ulnar injury. Option D-Turn buckle splint is used in Volkmanns ischemic contracture

choices.text: Periarticular fracture of knee, spanning fixator

questions.text: Which of the following is true about the type of fixation shown in the image?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) The image shows a periarticular fracture of the knee and a spanning external fixator used to stabilize the fracture. External fixators are used if the fracture is associated with severe soft tissue damage. It is also used if internal fixation is risky due to wound contamination. The spanning external fixator will stabilize the fracture until the condition of soft tissue improves.

questions.text: A 58-year-old post-menopausal lady comes to you with a DEXA report showing a T-score of -2.8 SD. Which of the following braces can be used to prevent pathological vertebral fractures in her?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Option A-Milwaukee brace is used for scoliosis. Option B-SOMI brace is used for cervical trauma. Option C-Boston brace is used for scoliosis. Option D-The given scenario with a T score of -2.8SD is suggestive of Osteoporosis. braces that can be used in the prophylactic bracing of the spine for the prevention of pathological vertebral fractures are the Anterior spinal hyperextension braces (ASHE) brace and the Taylor brace. Taylor brace – It is indicated for stabilization of the spine in dorsolumbar spinal injury. It is designed to control the upper and lower regions of the spinal column and support the spine while standing, sitting, and walking after spinal surgery.

choices.text: Proximal migration of the nail may lead to bursitis
Based on the concept of three point fixation
The eye of the nail is useful during its removal

questions.text: The postoperative X-ray of a patient who underwent femoral nailing is shown below. Which of the following statement is false regarding this nail?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-The above radiograph shows a K-nail (Kuntscher nail), identified by the absence of interlocking screws. A cloverleaf shape is seen on cross-section. This is designed to give a good rotational stability (tensile strength). Option B-Proximal migration of the nail may lead to bursitis. Option C-It is Based on the concept of three point fixation. Option D-The eye of the nail is useful during its removal.

questions.text: Which of the following is used to stabilise a fracture of the distal femur as shown in the image below?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-The above image shows a rail fixator.In this type of external fixator, multiple pins are inserted into the bone. These pins are then attached to different blocks which can move over a track or rail.

questions.text: Identify the following device.
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) The device shown in the image is a cock-up splint. It is used to manage radial nerve palsy. Radial nerve palsy manifests as an inability to dorsiflex the wrist and digits (wrist drop and finger drop). Numbness occurs on the dorsoradial aspect of the hand and the dorsal aspect of the radial 3 ½ digits. The cock-up splint is designed to counteract the wrist drop position by holding the wrist in a slightly extended or neutral position, which helps prevent further contracture and allows for functional use of the hand. Knuckle bender splint is used for claw hand.

questions.text: For which of the following conditions would a patient be prescribed the orthosis shown in the image below?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) The given image shows ankle-foot orthosis (foot drop brace) which is commonly used in foot drop. Foot drop occurs due to common peroneal nerve injury.

questions.text: Following a femoral shaft fracture, your consultant asks you to provide tibial traction. Which of the following will you request from the nurse? 1. Thomas splint 2. K-wire 3. Steinmann pin 4. Denham’s pin 5. Bohler’s stirrup 6. Bohler Braun splint
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Among the given options, Steinmann pin, Bohler’s stirrup, and Bohler Braun splint are used for tibial traction in femoral shaft fractures. 1. Thomas splint-used for fracture shaft femur 2. K-wire-used for traction in small bones. 3. Steinmann pin-used for traction in cortical bones such as tibia. 4. Denham’s pin-used for traction in cancellous bones such as calcaneum. 5. Bohler’s stirrup-all pins are connected to bohler`s stirrup 6. Bohler Braun splint-everything is ultimately connected to Bohler Braun splint.

questions.text: Identify the instrument in the given image that is used in spinal fusion surgery.
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) The instrument in the given image, used in spinal fusion surgery is a polyaxial pedicle screw Pedicle screws are used in a spinal fusion to add extra support and strength to the fusion while it heals. They are placed above and below the vertebrae that were fused. Rods are used to connect the screws which prevent the movement and allows the bone to heal.

questions.text: The splint shown in the image is used in the palsy of which nerve?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) The above image shows a knuckle bender splint which is used in the management of ulnar nerve palsy. In ulnar claw hand, there is loss of function of intrinsic muscles of the hand. So, knuckle bender splint is used to flex the metacarpophalangeal joint and extend the interphalangeal joint.

questions.text: Following a road traffic accident, a patient with an intertrochanteric fracture of the femur was treated with the implant shown below. Identify the implant.
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) The above radiograph shows an extramedullary implant called a dynamic hip screw. Intertrochanteric fractures of the femur can be treated by: - Extramedullary implants – dynamic hip screw - Intramedullary implants – proximal femoral nail and gamma nail. Dynamic hip screws are used in undisplaced intertrochanteric fractures whereas proximal femoral nails are used in displaced intertrochanteric fractures.

questions.text: Identify the instrument given below.
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) The instrument given is a bone nibbler, which is designed to remove or shape small sections of bone by gently nibbling or biting away at the bone tissue.

questions.text: Which of the following instruments can be used in both internal fixation of small bones and Ilizarov’s technique?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Of the following, Kirschner’s wire can be used in both the internal fixation of small bones and Ilizarov’s technique.

questions.text: The brace shown in the given image is
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) The brace shown in the image is the Milwaukee brace. The Milwaukee brace is an active corrective spinal orthosis primarily used in the ambulatory treatment of structural scoliosis. Designed as a cervico-thoracic-lumbar-sacral orthosis (CTLSO), the main objective of the Milwaukee brace is to delay or eliminate the need for surgery. However, in recent years, the use of the Milwaukee brace has declined due to the availability and convenience of modern braces. Nonetheless, it is still employed for scoliosis cases characterized by high thoracic and cervical spine curves.

questions.text: Identify the instrument shown below.
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) The given instrument is a cancellous screw. Cancellous screws have a larger thread and high pitch. Compression is produced by partial threading with a blunt tip.

questions.text: Identify the name of the instrument given below:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) The image shows a bone holding forceps.

questions.text: Following a road traffic accident, a patient develops type Illa compound tibial fracture. Arrange the following external fixators in decreasing order of their stability (highest to lowest). 1. Ilizarov fixator 2. Uniplanar with a single rod 3. Uniplanar with double rod 4. Biplanar frame/Ring with a cylindrical rod
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Among the given options, Ilizarov> Biplanar frame/Ring with cylindrical rod> Uniplanar with double rod> Uniplanar with a single rod (1>4>3>2) represents the correct order of stability of the given external fixators. External fixation provides rigid fixation of the bones.

choices.text: Nibbling the ends of the bones

questions.text: The following instrument is used for.
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) The image shown is of bone holding forceps (Verbrugge forceps). It is used to hold the bone and plate. It consists of a ratcheted clamp with a curved distal end.
